title: cool map
name: cool map
description:
A Map by Hairycuban

this map will tell you many interesting facts about many interesting places!!!!!!!

properties.name: Eiffel Tower
properties.description: Posted by HairycubanParisThe Eiffel tower was created 1887-1889 by Alexandre Gustave Eiffel. It was built for the International Exhibition of Paris of 1889. The Prince of Wales, later King Edward VII of England, opened the tower. Of the 700 proposals that were put in a design competition, Gustave Eiffel\'s was unanamously chosen. At 320 meters and 7000 tons it was the worlds largest building until 1930. The Eiffel tower is still visited today by millions of people.

properties.name: Empire State Building
properties.description: Posted by Hairycubannew york city, new yorkThe Empire State Building is located on 350 Fifth Avenue, between 33rd and 34th Streets,New York. It was built during the Great Depression and is a monument to that era. It was and still is New Yorks main attraction, and also it has starred in over 90 movies. The construction of the building began March of 1930 on the site of the old Waldof Astoria Hotel. It was completed 14 months later on March 14, 1931. The hight of the building is 1,472ft. And its 83,860 square ft.

properties.name: Great Pyramid Of Giza
properties.description: Posted by HairycubanThe Great Pyramid of Giza was built in the city of Giza, and today part of Greater Cairo, EgyptThe monument was built by the Egyptian pharaoh Khufu of the Fourth Dynasty around the year 2560 BC so he would have a tomb for when he died. The pyrimid is 135 meters and 229 meters long on each side.

properties.name: Great Wall of China
properties.description: Posted by HairycubanChinaThe Great wall of China was built over 2000 years ago by Qin Shi Huangdi who was the first emperor of China. They built the wall so they could protect the various dynasties from raids by Mongol, Turkic and other tribes. The Great wall of China was later on enlisted by UNESCO in 1987. The Great Wall of China streches accross deserts, grasslands,and moutains. The walls length is about 4,163 miles from east to west. Today sections of the wall have disapeared over time.

properties.name: Ground Zero
properties.description: Posted by Hairycubannew york cityThe World Trade Center was built in the early 1960s by the Downtown-Lower Manhattan Development Association to bring back the seedy radio row dominated by electronic stores.The north tower was opened in Dec. 1970 and the south tower in Jan. 1972; In order to create the 16-acre World Trade Center five streets were closed off and 164 buildings were destroyed . A total of 10,000 people worked on the towers; 60 died during its constructionere. However on 9/11/01 the two towers were destroyed by terrorists who hijacked two planes and crashed them into the towers.This attack killed 2,976 people. Now the area of which the enormous towers used to be is called Ground Zero.

properties.name: Mount Everest
properties.description: Posted by HairycubanasiaMount Everest is a mountain in the Himalayas. It is in Nepal and stands on the border of Tibet.The expedition that first reached the summit was in 1953, this was the eighth attempt.The peak was named after Sir George Everest. It is the tallest moutain in the world standing at 29,028ft.

properties.name: Mount Rushmore
properties.description: Posted by Hairycubansouth dAKOTAThis sculpture has the faces of four great American presidents George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Teddy Roosevelt, and Abraham Lincoln. South Dakota\'s Black Hills provide the back-drop for Mount Rushmore, the world\'s greatest mountain carving. These 60-foot high faces, are 500 feet above the land.Sculptor Gutzon Borglum began sculpting the faces into the mountain in 1927. This project took 14 years and cost million.

properties.name: Normandy Beach
properties.description: Posted by Hairycuban  europeThe Beach was where the Battle of D-Day was fought. The allied forces invaided the beach of Normandy on June 6, 1944. The invasion was plotted on June 5, 1944. Overnight, about 2,700 ships with landing craft and 176,000 soldiers cross the Channel. The allies came out of the end of the day with the beach secured.

properties.name: Panama Canal
properties.description: Posted by HairycubanpanamaIn 1534, Charles I of Spain ordered that they build a canal route through the Ismuth of Panama. More than three centuries later the construction was started. The French labored for 20 years, beginning in 1880, but disease and financial problems defeated them. In 1903, Panama and the United States signed a treaty which gave the United States the duty fo constructing an inter-oceanic ship canal across the Isthmus of Panama. The next year, the United States got 0 million from the French Canal Company and began construction. The project was completed in ten years and cost about 87 million. Since 1903 the United States has invested about billion in the Canal enterprise, approximately two-thirds of which has been recovered.

properties.name: Pearl Harbor
properties.description: Posted by Hairycubanpearl harborOn December 7, 1941 Japanese troops surprised the U.S troops with an airplane raid. The attacking planes came in two strikes, the first attack was at 7:53 AM, the second at 8:55. By 9:55 it was all over. The Japanese left the U.S with 2,403 dead soldiers,and 8 destroyed or damaged ships.
